Posts.Content: Hi thank you Sal and Karen for the lovely welcome Yes Karen they are thinking radiotherapy but will need to have my lump (size of a thumbnail) analysed for clarification and it will be 3 to 4 weeks for the results.  I feel lucky that they have found the cancer in its early stages via a routine mammogram but it’s still a shock when you receive your diagnosis and are not expecting it.   I now feel confident to post any questions or frustrations, thank you Again for the hugs. xx

Posts.Content: Hi, I’ve recently been diagnosed with breast cancer and am having a lumpectomy next week. I was looking for a group to join for support through my journey.
Posts.Title: Recently been diagnosed, looking for support through my journey.

Posts.Content: Hi Brook,  I started rads last Thursday (4th treatment today), I was told same as you E45 2 or 3 times a day. You have to wash certain products off before treatment but not E45, so I shower and cream in the morning. They told me that if I blister or burn they will give me a prescription.  I must say 4 treatments on and no problems, so good luck ladies, wishing you all the best with your rads too. Jill x
